{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3532161,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T00:28:26.188Z","cooked":"

We had a Kraken break the other day. The metal insert to screw in the CAN wires dislodged from the housing. What’s the proper way to RMA it to WCP for it to be replaced/fixed??

173992485250454317320356444919681920×2557 353 KB

173992487987732772172735922161381920×2557 451 KB

I had a similar issue, I emailed wcp (support@wcproducts.com i think), they forwarded to ctre who then sorted us out.

We had this happen the other day. It was caused by a team member using too long of a screw.

We were able to disassemble the motor and solder the threaded insert back onto the board.

The motor still works great, but we have demoted it to the practice robot for obvious reasons.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T11:20:38.802Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":81.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492257,"topic_slug":"kraken-screw-insert-broke","display_username":"Adam Bochek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7271,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RoboBitz / 2200 Coach"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-screw-insert-broke/492257/4","custom_user_title":"RoboBitz / 2200 Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532720,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T14:14:13.629Z","cooked":"

That, or Ive had similar electrical standoffs break free from the solder pads by over-torquing the screws.

Recommend OP use the recommended torq wrenches sold by a few FRC suppliers for these Kraken ring terminal connections.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T14:14:13.629Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":165,"readers_count":164,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492257,"topic_slug":"kraken-screw-insert-broke","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7271,"username":"Bochek","name":"Adam Bochek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bochek/{size}/2414_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/kraken-screw-insert-broke/492257/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532739,"name":"Alex","username":"legoguy1000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T14:29:24.290Z","cooked":"

We used the provided screws and only hand tightened them so I think it was just a bad solder to begin with. its the only one we’ve had an issue with out of the dozen we have.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T14:29:24.290Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492257,"topic_slug":"kraken-screw-insert-broke","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-screw-insert-broke/492257/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532814,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T15:01:05.495Z","cooked":"

“Hand tightened” doesn’t mean lot. How long was the allen wrench you used? How hard did it get cranked? There’s a reason the torque wrenches for the can and power wires exist. We’ve never had a wire come loose using them, and we’ve never damaged a kraken.

That isn’t to say it isn’t possible - but I’d highly recommended buying a set or two. They aren’t horribly expensive and they do a great job of giving you a good connection every time.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T15:01:05.495Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492257,"topic_slug":"kraken-screw-insert-broke","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28614,"username":"legoguy1000","name":"Alex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legoguy1000/{size}/256261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-screw-insert-broke/492257/7","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532822,"name":"Erik Boyle","username":"Ekcrbe","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekcrbe/{size}/221615_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T15:09:40.766Z","cooked":"

To add onto Tom’s point, if you use the recommended torque wrenches, you’ll notice that what you’d normally think of as “hand tight” is actually significantly more torque than you should be using.

I hear what ur saying, but we didn’t use allen wrenches, just a straight driver so I don’t think we over torqued it but if u can provide a link to the Torque wrenches, i’ll take a look

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T15:15:57.166Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492257,"topic_slug":"kraken-screw-insert-broke","display_username":"Alex","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28614,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor & Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-screw-insert-broke/492257/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor & Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532849,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T15:21:48.934Z","cooked":"

A warning: the Kraken to Anderson adapter boards come with screws where the big and small screws have the SAME socket! Waaaay to easy to over torque if you can put the high torque torx in the tiny screw…

CTR Electronics

Pre-Set Torque Wrench

These Pre-Set torque wrenches with IP style bits are designed to make attaching Kraken X60 terminal leads easy and consistent. Two torque pre-sets are available - one for power leads and one for CAN leads. The clicking action provides audible and...

Price: USD 29.99
